response: narrative=Pauline Wheeler was last seen at her family's farm in the vicinity of her home in Forfar. On the day of her disappearance, Pauline's sister mentioned that she had been spending a significant amount of time online. It is understood that Pauline had recently gotten in touch with an unknown online group, which she often engaged with, raising concerns among her family. On the day she went missing, an unexpected absence during routine farm activities was reported by her family. After being unable to contact her, family members alerted the authorities. The investigation led to her being traced by police at King's Cross Road. No foul play was suspected, and Pauline was safely reunited with her family.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler, a 13-year-old from Edinburgh, was last reported missing from her home on New Road, Forfar. Known to be in touch with an unknown online group, her sudden disappearance raised concerns among her family, particularly her uncle, Mohammed Wheeler, and her mother. She was supposed to join a family trip to a resort but never arrived, which prompted the involvement of the authorities. Initial speculation suggested she might have been influenced by individuals she met online. After days of search and investigation, Pauline was traced by police on East School Road, Dundee, safe but shaken. The details of her activities during the period remain unclear, but she has since been reunited with her family, who were relieved and eager to understand the events that transpired.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler went missing from her home and was last seen near Tayside Street, Carnoustie. She was reportedly heading towards a mountain hike with Marcus Lees. Police traced her to King's Cross Road after a week-long search.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler was last seen leaving her part-time job located on Tayside Street, Carnoustie, DD7 6AX. Known to have been in touch with an unknown online group, her sudden disappearance caused concern among her family. Her brother last spoke to her near their home, but she seemed elusive during the conversation. Reports indicate Pauline wished to explore the mountain area nearby, fueled by discussions she had with the online group. Her aunt discovered Pauline's interest in traveling to Adelaide Place, Dundee, DD3 6LE, adding to the growing worries about her choices. Pauline was eventually traced safe to King's Cross Road, DD2 3PT, by a member of the public amid relief from her grandfather, Terence Bryan.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler, in touch with an unknown online group, disappeared from a gym on Tayside Street, Carnoustie. Her brother last spotted her heading toward the mountain near Kirsty Semple Way, Dundee.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler, a 14-year-old, was last seen at the dance studio on Tayside Street, Carnoustie, before she went missing. Her sister mentioned that Pauline had expressed interest in exploring rural areas near a resort nestled in the nearby mountain ranges, often talking about hiking and spending time at a farm they once visited. Concern grew when she did not return home, as she had a tendency to wander in those areas, particularly around the university grounds during her school breaks. A search party was organized, focusing on these familiar places. Fortunately, a member of the public spotted her safe and sound, simply enthralled by the open spaces and chasing a sense of adventure.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler, a 15-year-old from Forfar, was reported missing after not returning home from her visit to a mountain near Dundee. Her brother mentioned that Pauline had been in touch with an unknown online group that sparked her interest in exploring remote areas. She was last seen leaving her home with a backpack, headed towards Adelaide Place, Dundee. Concern grew when she did not show up at her grandfather Simon Donnelly's residence at 11 Panmure Terrace, Dundee, where she was expected. Authorities later found her safe at a friend's house in Forfar after an extensive search of nearby mountains.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler was last seen leaving her part-time job near 19 Dalgleish Street, Tayport. She frequented a resort managed by Carl Jennings, a colleague. Reports revealed she was in touch with an unknown online group. She was eventually located at a farm in Dundee.

narrative=Pauline Wheeler was last seen at her family’s farm near Forfar. Her friend, Henry Kirk, reported that they planned to visit the movie theater but never arrived. Concern grew as it was discovered she had not attended the dance studio or university in Dundee as expected. Authorities focused their search around local landmarks, including the addresses 135 Rosebank Street and Stannergate Road. Five days later, Pauline was safely located by a member of the public at 12 South Esk Road.
